comments:
Testing fix for bug 46272... works better but now throws a different exception.

From Test scenario JVEWRKB01 - Test Visual Editor interactions with the Eclipse 
workbench

Create a new visual class extending JFrame.
When the VE is open, select File-->Save As... and give it a new name.
This will save the file and create some compile errors because the class name 
is different from the file name (this is okay). 

The problem is the new class shows up as a non-visual icon and the content pane 
is dumped to the canvas. Also a java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError is thrown 
in the log. Even if you correct the compile errors by changing the name, the 
the canvas does not show the beans correctly again. Even reload from scratch 
fails. You have save, close, and reopen the VE.
Here's the exception in the log:
!MESSAGE Could not instantiate JFrame1X with default ctor
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ve.java.core 2 0 Nov 17, 2003 15:17:54.233
!MESSAGE Exception
!STACK 0
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: IWAV0118E Class JFrame1X (or one of its 
superclasses) is not found or has errors.
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.BeanProxyAdapter.primInstantiateBeanProxy
(BeanProxyAdapter.java:911)
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.BeanProxyAdapter.instantiateBeanProxy
(BeanProxyAdapter.java:752)
	at org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.CompositionProxyAdapter.initSetting
(CompositionProxyAdapter.java:125)
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.CompositionProxyAdapter.notifyChanged
(CompositionProxyAdapter.java:78)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifierImpl.eNotify
(NotifierImpl.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationChainImpl.dispatch
(NotificationChainImpl.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationChainImpl.dispatch
(NotificationChainImpl.java:103)
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.jcm.impl.BeanSubclassCompositionImpl.setThisPart
(BeanSubclassCompositionImpl.java:132)
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.addBeanPart
(JavaSourceTranslator.java:796)
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.buildCompositionM
odel(JavaSourceTranslator.java:870)
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.decodeDocument
(JavaSourceTranslator.java:940)
	at org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator$5.run
(JavaSourceTranslator.java:1135)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages
(Synchronizer.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages
(Synchronizer.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1385)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:858)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)

I'm afraid I have to return this as invalid. We work off of the saved copy. The
problem was that after the name was fixed up it wasn't saved. So the new name
wasn't recorded in the Java EMF Model since it was not saved but was in the
working copy. If a save and then a reload from scratch was done, it would of
been ok. No need to actually close the editor.

The only thing that may be fixable is that on the save we could of done a reload
from scratch. But we typically don't do that because typically everything is ok
and the save only put out what we already have. But in this case we needed a
reload to get the new class hierarchy.

If you feel that we should do a reload, please reopen, but make its priority an
enhancement since we wouldn't be able to get to it until next release.
M1 released, move all resolved to Verified, as prelude to closing.
M1 released, move all resolved/verified to Closed.

traces.message: IWAV0118E Class JFrame1X (or one of its  superclasses) is not found or has errors.
